commit_message:
Add display of atomic actions timer in CLI

Added a prettytable that prints detailed information about the
execution time of each atomic action.

Implements: blueprint time-measuring-of-atomic-actions
(Part "II) CLI" of time-measuring-of-atomic-actions)

Change-Id: I1558d324a92063db3bd3d09d67b0635b93390107

commit_message:
Fix race condition in delete_port method. Fix update_port method

Port can be gone between
  l3plugin.prevent_l3_port_deletion(context, id)
and port query. Need to handle it properly.
ALso need to handle non-existing port in update_port properly.

Closes-Bug: #1266537

Change-Id: Ic203f21db277f83c604a8757a8c421b3fb9ae709

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-09 01:43:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/agents_db.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/__init__.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/agentnotifiers/test_dhcp_rpc_agent_api.py'], 'message': 'Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status

The Neutron service, when under load, may not be able to process
agent heartbeats in a timely fashion.  This can result in
agents being erroneously considered inactive.  Previously, DHCP
notifications for which active agents could not be found were
silently dropped.  This change ensures that notifications for
a given network are sent to agents even if those agents do not
appear to be active.

Additionally, if no enabled dhcp agents can be found for a given
network, an error will be logged.  Raising an exception might be
preferable, but has such a large testing impact that it will be
submitted as a separate patch if deemed necessary.

Closes-bug: #1192381
(cherry picked from commit 522f9f94681de5903422cfde11b93f5c0e71e532)

Change-Id: Id3e639d9cf3d16708fd66a4baebd3fbeeed3dde8
'}]
commit_message:
Send DHCP notifications regardless of agent status

The Neutron service, when under load, may not be able to process
agent heartbeats in a timely fashion.  This can result in
agents being erroneously considered inactive.  Previously, DHCP
notifications for which active agents could not be found were
silently dropped.  This change ensures that notifications for
a given network are sent to agents even if those agents do not
appear to be active.

Additionally, if no enabled dhcp agents can be found for a given
network, an error will be logged.  Raising an exception might be
preferable, but has such a large testing impact that it will be
submitted as a separate patch if deemed necessary.

Closes-bug: #1192381
(cherry picked from commit 522f9f94681de5903422cfde11b93f5c0e71e532)

Change-Id: Id3e639d9cf3d16708fd66a4baebd3fbeeed3dde8

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-20 21:48:16.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Combine debug and verbose commandline options

Most of the openstack clients (for example nova) when --debug is specified it
shows the api calls the client is making. However, when debug is passed into
the neutronclient it shows exceptions that have occurred inside the
neutronclient. This patch combines verbose and debug to do the samething.

Change-Id: I6f2e0b17ffbe8fbfa77e26222dae32f5ab1e8866
Closes-bug: #1260489
'}]
commit_message:
Combine debug and verbose commandline options

Most of the openstack clients (for example nova) when --debug is specified it
shows the api calls the client is making. However, when debug is passed into
the neutronclient it shows exceptions that have occurred inside the
neutronclient. This patch combines verbose and debug to do the samething.

Change-Id: I6f2e0b17ffbe8fbfa77e26222dae32f5ab1e8866
Closes-bug: #1260489

commit_message:
Stacktrace on error from libvirt during unfilter

We are seeing this issue freqently in the gate, but we don't have any
stacktrace for what is happening.  An error from libvirt is an
unexpected exception and should include a stacktrace.

Related-Bug: #1275256
Change-Id: If7c0e19aba7a3d129f4b82f52d86b8e3b6a0a194

commit_message:
Reduce severity of log messages in validation methods

I noticed this while reviewing Ic2c87174.  When I read through log
files, I don't want to see errors like this that come from validating
bad user input.  Info severity is more appropriate.

Change-Id: Ib8a4dd08570923c6cade6447b52bb73d20558258
Closes-Bug: #1272565

The metadata agent currently runs with a default socket backlog
of 128.  This isn't enough on a busy network node, even when
spawning multiple worker processes.

This change addes a new "metadata_backlog = XX" to the ini file

'}]
commit_message:
Change metadata-agent to have a configurable backlog

The metadata agent currently runs with a default socket backlog
of 128.  This isn't enough on a busy network node, even when
spawning multiple worker processes.

This change addes a new "metadata_backlog = XX" to the ini file
to support a configurable value to help improve performance.

Change-Id: Ibea398f3b65a56deb1418f39810d87d8360ea9f3
Closes-bug: #1274536

commit_message:
Change metadata-agent to spawn multiple workers

There is currently only one metadata-agent per network node,
which could be handling connections from hundreds or thousands
of metadata-namespace-proxy processes.

This change addes a new "metadata_workers = XX" to the ini file
to support creating more workers to help improve performance.

Change-Id: Ib9ebcfc543a83982dd93db79c7dc631283fd3bfa
Partial-bug: #1274536

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-02-05 06:46:34.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': 'Avoid re-wiring ports unnecessarily

In the majority of cases a port_update notification pertains
a change in the properties affecting port filter, and does
not affect port wiring, ie: the local vlan tag.

This patch simply avoids doing port wiring/unwiring if the
local vlan tag did not change.
The extra overhead for the ovs-db get operation is offset
by the fact that get commands are generally faster than
set commands, and by avoiding executing the ovs-ofctl operation.

Partial-Bug: #1253993
Partially implements blueprint: neutron-tempest-parallel

Change-Id: Ia0bd2dc4e5a2634a4c863ff32ccc5cabe8e21337
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid re-wiring ports unnecessarily

In the majority of cases a port_update notification pertains
a change in the properties affecting port filter, and does
not affect port wiring, ie: the local vlan tag.

This patch simply avoids doing port wiring/unwiring if the
local vlan tag did not change.
The extra overhead for the ovs-db get operation is offset
by the fact that get commands are generally faster than
set commands, and by avoiding executing the ovs-ofctl operation.

Partial-Bug: #1253993
Partially implements blueprint: neutron-tempest-parallel

Change-Id: Ia0bd2dc4e5a2634a4c863ff32ccc5cabe8e21337

commit_message:
Migrating trove to entry points

PBR/Distribute generates binscripts for us. By moving the
binscript code into the source tree, we can unit test it
as well. Run setup.py develop to generate the binscripts for
development use.

implements blueprint entrypoints-for-binscripts
Change-Id: I9ad4bb4ddc55f64bcd806c588a795cd6e0847aa9

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-04 15:04:18.000000000', 'files': ['spec/support/matchers.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'CHANGELOG.md', 'metadata.rb', 'spec/default-redhat_spec.rb', 'recipes/default.rb'], 'message': 'Use version 3 of the yum cookbook

The 3rd verison of the yum cookbook introduces breaking changes,
so all cookbooks that use it need to be modified.
* Remove uses and tests for yum_key resource.
* Add gpgkey arg to yum_repository resource.
* Removed custom spec matchers as these are now provided by the yum cookbook.

Change-Id: I1ce649b92fbd39010d88048ee2daf317425f0374
'}]
commit_message:
Use version 3 of the yum cookbook

The 3rd verison of the yum cookbook introduces breaking changes,
so all cookbooks that use it need to be modified.
* Remove uses and tests for yum_key resource.
* Add gpgkey arg to yum_repository resource.
* Removed custom spec matchers as these are now provided by the yum cookbook.

blueprint yum-cookbook-v3-support

Change-Id: I1ce649b92fbd39010d88048ee2daf317425f0374

subject: Handle exception messages with six.text_type
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-02-04 16:56:53.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/exception.py'], 'message': 'Handle exception messages with six.text_type

Handle exception messages with six.text_type tools instead of using
string. This is necessary becase a message can contain
non-ascii characters and it can cause the unicode error:
"UnicodeError: Message objects do not support str() because they may
contain non-ascii characters. Please use unicode() or translate()
instead."

Change-Id: I3312b75731c1ce49e2f1069c83e1a868805409d3
Closes-Bug: #1273301
'}]
commit_message:
Handle exception messages with six.text_type

Handle exception messages with six.text_type tools instead of using
string. This is necessary becase a message can contain
non-ascii characters and it can cause the unicode error:
"UnicodeError: Message objects do not support str() because they may
contain non-ascii characters. Please use unicode() or translate()
instead."

Change-Id: I3312b75731c1ce49e2f1069c83e1a868805409d3
Closes-Bug: #1273301

commit_message:
Clean up notification settings in glance-api.conf

Currently, rabbitmq settings in glance-api.conf are hard-coded and
overrides to rabbitmq settings in environment will not be reflected in
configuration file.  This change addresses that while also only writing
rabbitmq/qpid settings when an appropriate notification strategy is
selected.

Change-Id: I9d06d4b1e030f14293d143021bd78d732adafcc2
Closes-Bug: #1273020

subject: Be really careful with non-ascii data in exceptions/failures
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-02-04 21:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils_failure.py', 'taskflow/exceptions.py', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': 'Be really careful with non-ascii data in exceptions/failures

When exception message is Python 2 str with non-ascii symbols,
six.text_type(exc) raises UnicodeError. This change handles this
case gracefully by calling str() instead of string.text_type()
on such exceptions when retrieving messages for exceptions/failures.

Closes-bug: 1276053
Change-Id: I2eb7318a7a5cd5dd687390a65abc0a45bd47de40
'}]
commit_message:
Be really careful with non-ascii data in exceptions/failures

When exception message is Python 2 str with non-ascii symbols,
six.text_type(exc) raises UnicodeError. This change handles this
case gracefully by calling str() instead of string.text_type()
on such exceptions when retrieving messages for exceptions/failures.

Closes-bug: 1276053
Change-Id: I2eb7318a7a5cd5dd687390a65abc0a45bd47de40

commit_message:
Add ability to break TaskManager locks via REST API

The 'reservation' attribute is used by Ironic to manage exclusive
locks. This patch allows only clean existing reservation via API
PATCH method if conductor which reserved a node is inactive.

Closes-Bug: #1250348
blueprint breaking-resource-locks
Change-Id: I9b0d5aae7fa7742a3ae43aa725085a393f1e6eda

commit_message:
Assign only one IP per node in admin network

Extra IPs are not necessary to ensure reliable
PXE installation. We simply need to add each
MAC to the Cobbler profile to ensure that the
correct profile is chosen.

Change-Id: I0deea1d88f8e99f7743fd3b2df01ebaa8c0d914e

subject: Allow the usage of a passed in sqlalchemy engine
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 21:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/persistence/backends/impl_sqlalchemy.py'], 'message': 'Allow the usage of a passed in sqlalchemy engine

In certain use-cases a user of taskflow will likely
have a pre-existing engine that they want to use with
out SQLAlchemyBackend. To allow them to provide such
an engine via the backends constructor for use-cases
where this makes sense.

At the same time move the validation function the
connection class so that it can be called by users
to verify their connection is valid.

Change-Id: I8150194570a84e19712d7d4ca66b79b7161a76e7
'}]
commit_message:
Allow the usage of a passed in sqlalchemy engine

In certain use-cases a user of taskflow will likely
have a pre-existing engine that they want to use with
out SQLAlchemyBackend. To allow them to provide such
an engine via the backends constructor for use-cases
where this makes sense.

At the same time move the validation function the
connection class so that it can be called by users
to verify their connection is valid.

Change-Id: I8150194570a84e19712d7d4ca66b79b7161a76e7

commit_message:
Remove versionId, versionInfo, versionList from examples

I recall these attributes being discussed at one point
(pre-incubation?), but have never been supported by OpenStack and don't
appear to be defined in any v2.0 WADL/XSD specification.

Change-Id: Ia5b691972c70456e3d62750173e2bfc6e9aec55a
Closes-Bug: 1273831

subject: The misterious sleep which removes the sins of nova-cpu
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 15:11:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': 'The misterious sleep which removes the sins of nova-cpu

I am justing verifying that a sleep would really prevent the hang
observed in the compute service when injection is disabled.
Then, if that is confirmed, I would love to understand where this
weird racey behaviour would be coming from.

Change-Id: I0719e2d2e4cf3828a90ba28695e1633c51926708
'}]
commit_message:
The misterious sleep which removes the sins of nova-cpu

I am justing verifying that a sleep would really prevent the hang
observed in the compute service when injection is disabled.
Then, if that is confirmed, I would love to understand where this
weird racey behaviour would be coming from.

Change-Id: I0719e2d2e4cf3828a90ba28695e1633c51926708

commit_message:
Who wants namespace processes to live forever?

I will spare you the pain of another song lyrics.

This is an attempt at verifying whether this 'last resort'
approach might be adopted while we sort our issues with the
kernel.

Change-Id: I8f16336cfd074ece243c22216f039aa9ed6c1ad1

and update references accordingly.

commit_message:
Change 'oauth_extension' to 'oauth1_extension'

The documentation uses 'oauth1_extension' but the configuration files
an tests use 'oauth_extension'. This change sets all of them to
oauth1_extension.

Closes-Bug: #1275693
Change-Id: I279f08e262d6f1ae8afea58fd46576e3eabf3875
DocImpact: Extension name has been changed in keystone-paste.ini,
therefore the pipeline may need to be adjusted as well

[{'number': 23, 'created': '2014-02-05 06:38:26.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/plugins/openvswitch/agent/ovs_neutron_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/openvswitch/test_ovs_tunnel.py'], 'message': "Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

Instead of processing a port update notification directly in
the RPC call, the actual processing is moved into the main
rpc loop, whereas the RPC call just adds the updated port
identifier to a set of updated ports.
In this way, a port_update notification won't compete with the
main rpc loop, causing long delays into its completion under
heavy load. Also, repeated port_update notifications received
within a single iteration of the main agent loop will be
coalesced and processed only once.
This will also avoid the risk of processing notifications out
of order thus ending up with an actual configuration which
differs from the desired one.

This patch still performs L2 wiring for updated ports even if
it is necessary only when the administrative state of a port
changes.

The update_ports method has been renamed to scan_ports as the latter
name appears to be more in line with what the method actually does.

Partial-Bug: #1253993
Partially implements blueprint: neutron-tempest-parallel
Change-Id: I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd
"}]
commit_message:
Process port_update notifications in the main agent loop

Instead of processing a port update notification directly in
the RPC call, the actual processing is moved into the main
rpc loop, whereas the RPC call just adds the updated port
identifier to a set of updated ports.
In this way, a port_update notification won't compete with the
main rpc loop, causing long delays into its completion under
heavy load. Also, repeated port_update notifications received
within a single iteration of the main agent loop will be
coalesced and processed only once.
This will also avoid the risk of processing notifications out
of order thus ending up with an actual configuration which
differs from the desired one.

This patch still performs L2 wiring for updated ports even if
it is necessary only when the administrative state of a port
changes.

The update_ports method has been renamed to scan_ports as the latter
name appears to be more in line with what the method actually does.

Partial-Bug: #1253993
Partially implements blueprint: neutron-tempest-parallel
Change-Id: I219c6bdf63b0b5e945b655677f9e28fa591f03cd

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-21 04:08:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Minimize the cost of checking for api worker exit

A recent change to oslo allows the configuration of the interval
that ProcessLauncher waits between checks of child exit.  The
default interval of 0.01s resulted in the neutron service consuming
unnecessary cpu cycles checking whether api workers had exited (5%
cpu on idle in a VM).  This patch extends the interval to 1s to
minimize the cost of the checks.

Change-Id: I0407ccb2db65cd3839586faff15e70dbc35f005e
Closes-bug: #1095346
'}]
commit_message:
Minimize the cost of checking for api worker exit

A recent change to oslo allows the configuration of the interval
that ProcessLauncher waits between checks of child exit.  The
default interval of 0.01s resulted in the neutron service consuming
unnecessary cpu cycles checking whether api workers had exited (5%
cpu on idle in a VM).  This patch extends the interval to 1s to
minimize the cost of the checks.

Change-Id: I0407ccb2db65cd3839586faff15e70dbc35f005e
Closes-bug: #1095346

subject: Run zookeeper tests if localhost has a compat. zookeeper server
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-02-04 21:47:01.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/tests/unit/persistence/test_zk_persistence.py'], 'message': 'Run zookeeper tests if localhost has a compat. zookeeper server

If a local zookeeper server is running then using that
zookeeper server we are able to run the zookeeper tests,
so instead of always turning these tests off; only turn
them off if no zookeeper server is found.

Change-Id: I27bbc67b4f2d03a4469882fdc3b8015324ad7e3b
'}]
commit_message:
Run zookeeper tests if localhost has a compat. zookeeper server

If a local zookeeper server is running then using that
zookeeper server we are able to run the zookeeper tests,
so instead of always turning these tests off; only turn
them off if no zookeeper server is found.

Change-Id: I27bbc67b4f2d03a4469882fdc3b8015324ad7e3b

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-04 14:45:15.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_sshutils.py', 'rally/serverprovider/provider.py', 'tests/deploy/engines/test_devstack.py', 'rally/benchmark/scenarios/nova/servers.py', 'rally/serverprovider/providers/lxc.py', 'rally/serverprovider/providers/lxc/tunnel-remote.sh', 'rally/sshutils.py', 'tests/serverprovider/providers/test_lxc.py', 'tests/benchmark/scenarios/nova/test_servers.py', 'rally/deploy/engines/devstack.py'], 'message': "Sshutils refactoring

Paramiko sftp client is not eventlet friendly. Also it doesn't work
with some servers, so upload/download methods has been removed.
Downloading or uploading can be done in other way (see examples).

Added ability to pass process stdin, which makes possible to
do on remote host anything at all.

Much more clean and usable API.

Change-Id: If357a2878c2c60646a975c386a0fe2f1616aec95
"}]
commit_message:
Sshutils refactoring

Paramiko sftp client is not eventlet friendly. Also it doesn't work
with some servers, so upload/download methods has been removed.
Downloading or uploading can be done in other way (see examples).

Added ability to pass process stdin, which makes possible to
do on remote host anything at all.

Much more clean and usable API.

Change-Id: If357a2878c2c60646a975c386a0fe2f1616aec95

commit_message:
Ensure mapping rule has only local and remote properties

As per the API spec, a mapping rule reference should only have a
local and remote properties.
This change ensures that the schema used to validate mappings
fulfills that requirement.

bp mapping-distributed-admin

Change-Id: I00468c56d9b6689789b2123c3797c56cc73517d1

commit_message:
Sync OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE with keystone

For now, keystone default role is _member_, while horizon set
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_DEFAULT_ROLE to Member. It will really be user
friendly to modify horizon default value to _member_ to sync with
keystone's default setting.

Conflicts:

    doc/source/topics/settings.rst

Change-Id: I55d15e6cfb74e52e933c5a44efd6c27930415738
Closes-Bug: #1264228
(cherry picked from commit 0aacc44f324c3db049f912da1f84d93c1142cb37)

subject: find server boot time using datetime
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2934, 'name': 'Bhuvan Arumugam', 'email': 'bhuvan@apache.org', 'username': 'bhuvan'}, {'_account_id': 4460, 'name': 'Vincent Untz', 'email': 'vuntz@opensuse.org', 'username': 'vuntz'}, {'_account_id': 7139, 'name': 'Zhi Kun Liu', 'username': 'zhikunliu', 'inactive': True}, {'_account_id': 7872, 'name': 'Marc Koderer', 'email': 'marc@koderer.com', 'username': 'mkoderer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-21 08:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py', 'tempest/common/utils/__init__.py'], 'message': 'find server boot time using datetime

cirros image doesn't recognize human readable date format. It complain
following error when this command is executed by a test case.
$ date -d "`cut -f1 -d. /proc/uptime` seconds ago" "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
date: invalid date '2336 seconds ago'

Get the boot time from /proc/uptime and calculate boot time using datetime.

Closes-Bug: 1244823
Change-Id: If5c295ec06921aae4c6a7eb0edba39ff9e3946bf
'}]
commit_message:
find server boot time using datetime

cirros image doesn't recognize human readable date format. It complain
following error when this command is executed by a test case.
$ date -d "`cut -f1 -d. /proc/uptime` seconds ago" "+%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"
date: invalid date '2336 seconds ago'

Get the boot time from /proc/uptime and calculate boot time using datetime.

Closes-Bug: 1244823
Change-Id: If5c295ec06921aae4c6a7eb0edba39ff9e3946bf

subject: Don't use metaclasses for thread-safe storage
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-01-28 09:46:31.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/engines/action_engine/engine.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py', 'taskflow/utils/lock_utils.py', 'taskflow/utils/threading_utils.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_suspend_flow.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils_locks.py'], 'message': "Don't use metaclasses for thread-safe storage

Provide a wrapper that works as locking decorator instead of metaclass.
This solution should be better, because:
- it does not use metaclasses, so it's simpler;
- it locks the lock only on interface boundaries, which allows to use
  non-recursive locks and avoids some overhead;
- it has unit-tests.

Closes-bug: #1273146
Change-Id: I69d566345847a79cbda3463f3545be5357cd1762
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use metaclasses for thread-safe storage

Provide a wrapper that works as locking decorator instead of metaclass.
This solution should be better, because:
- it does not use metaclasses, so it's simpler;
- it locks the lock only on interface boundaries, which allows to use
  non-recursive locks and avoids some overhead;
- it has unit-tests.

Closes-bug: #1273146
Change-Id: I69d566345847a79cbda3463f3545be5357cd1762

overlapping subnets.  It does no checking for a CIDR prefix which

commit_message:
Disallow single IP subnets in neutron

Currently, NeutronDbPluginV2._validate_subnet_cidr() only checks for
overlapping subnets.  It does no checking for a CIDR prefix which
would allow only one IP in the subnet.  Horizon prevents this in the
UI, but neutron does not so CLI can still push this invalid subnet
through.  This fix is to close this gap and disallow subnets with
only one IP.

Change-Id: Ic2c871749c2fa3c8d2bacecf1062bde0eca5bd6c
Closes-Bug: #1271311

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-02-05 00:32:11.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_multi_part.py', 'heat/engine/resources/software_config/multi_part.py'], 'message': "A multipart cloud-init resource based on SoftwareConfig

This simple resource allows a multipart mime message to be built out
of an assembly of other SoftwareConfig resources. These assembled resources
will generally be a mixture of OS::Heat::CloudConfig and
OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig resources.

The full multipart content is fetched and stored during resource create.
This is safe since SoftwareConfig data is immutable once created.

Because cloud-init is boot only, this resource won't be used with
a SoftwareDeployment resource, also it will not have inputs or outputs.

Instead, a server's user_data can contain this resource via get_resource
when user_data_format is SOFTWARE_CONFIG.

Implements: blueprint cloud-init-resource

Change-Id: Id72f6ccb6802d654a1dec31f37fb0bcab0e36843
"}]
commit_message:
A multipart cloud-init resource based on SoftwareConfig

This simple resource allows a multipart mime message to be built out
of an assembly of other SoftwareConfig resources. These assembled resources
will generally be a mixture of OS::Heat::CloudConfig and
OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig resources.

The full multipart content is fetched and stored during resource create.
This is safe since SoftwareConfig data is immutable once created.

Because cloud-init is boot only, this resource won't be used with
a SoftwareDeployment resource, also it will not have inputs or outputs.

Instead, a server's user_data can contain this resource via get_resource
when user_data_format is SOFTWARE_CONFIG.

Implements: blueprint cloud-init-resource

Change-Id: Id72f6ccb6802d654a1dec31f37fb0bcab0e36843

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 08:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/test_notifications.py', 'keystone/notifications.py'], 'message': "Fix test case hidden by catch-all exception

To prevent a notification failure causing a global failure of keystone
to perform operations there is a catch all exception handler around the
notifications code.

In the case of one of our tests there was an issuing with stubbing such
that the mocked function was never actually being called and the
exception handler was masking the problem.

Fix the error to make sure it's called and fix the test that
subsequently fails.

Change-Id: I79420bbecf9d47d1d6bb175bec202ec2d9d8a113
Blueprint: oslo-messaging
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test case hidden by catch-all exception

To prevent a notification failure causing a global failure of keystone
to perform operations there is a catch all exception handler around the
notifications code.

In the case of one of our tests there was an issuing with stubbing such
that the mocked function was never actually being called and the
exception handler was masking the problem.

Fix the error to make sure it's called and fix the test that
subsequently fails.

Change-Id: I79420bbecf9d47d1d6bb175bec202ec2d9d8a113
Blueprint: oslo-messaging

commit_message:
Store files in the raw_template table

With the get_files intrinsic function, the files data will need to be
available at any time. This change adds a files column to the raw_template
table and saves/loads files from Template class.

Change-Id: I9fd705326ecfe7ca9e00624c67e7dd1965f95a96

commit_message:
Resource type for software configuration

    Implementation of the SoftwareConfig resource. Some notes on the implementation:
    * This is a simple wrapper over the REST API, and is essentially
      just for defining data which gets stored.
    * SoftwareConfig will always be UpdateReplace, and the REST entity
      is immutable.
    * OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig will sometimes be used in a template directly
      and sometimes inside a resource provider template which
      defines CM-tool specific properties and aggregates the result into
      the OS::Heat::SoftwareConfig config property.

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I7350c31ec59d152751c6aa7d811a91e1df62e89d

commit_message:
Add rules to be a required field for mapping schema

Previously the mapping schema would have validated a mapping
reference that had no rules key. This patch enforces that a rules
key be present.
I also removed the `name` key from a fixture, note that the name
key would not have made the schema fail.

bp mapping-distributed-admin

Change-Id: I64cb8a3333fe9a9372262b490348d52d1373dbb0

commit_message:
Grants DB access to Users in Instance create API

Reasons:
- When database and users are provided as arguments, created users do not
  get access on suggested databases in cli instance create command.
- This was happening because database was not passed along with user info.

Changes:
- Concatenated the database information with the user info.

subject: Let swift-object-info skip etag verification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-16 20:57:14.000000000', 'files': ['bin/swift-object-info'], 'message': 'Let swift-object-info skip etag verification

Now swift-object-info has a "-n" option that will cause the etag
verification to be skipped; on large objects, the etag verification
takes the vast majority of the runtime, and sometimes you just want to
know which account owns the 5 GB monstrosity without waiting around while
its checksum is verified.

Change-Id: Id284570633eb7b98046cdb948d7c37a152de1195
'}]
commit_message:
Let swift-object-info skip etag verification

Now swift-object-info has a "-n" option that will cause the etag
verification to be skipped; on large objects, the etag verification
takes the vast majority of the runtime, and sometimes you just want to
know which account owns the 5 GB monstrosity without waiting around while
its checksum is verified.

Change-Id: Id284570633eb7b98046cdb948d7c37a152de1195

subject: Replace urllib/urlparse with six.moves.*
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-01-31 17:34:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/controllers.py', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_oauth1.py', 'keystone/middleware/s3_token.py', 'keystone/middleware/ec2_token.py', 'keystone/common/base64utils.py'], 'message': 'Replace urllib/urlparse with six.moves.*

urllib and urlparse are divided to different module in Python 3.

Part of blueprint keystone-py3kcompat

'}]
commit_message:
Replace urllib/urlparse with six.moves.*

urllib and urlparse are divided to different module in Python 3.
Use six.moves.* to make them on Python 2 and Python 3.

Part of blueprint keystone-py3kcompat

Change-Id: I54d322c51f0f87e3ec00c69016251d6ea5015adb

commit_message:
Forbid availability_zone None in aggregate Nova API

In aggregate API, argument "availability_zone" became optional in the request.
Fixed tempest code same as nova.

Change-Id: I73f42c6c069a9bc6318ac3bac5ec94b61c65ecaf
Related-bug: #1252177

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1779, 'name': 'Daniel Berrange', 'email': 'berrange@redhat.com', 'username': 'berrange'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5046, 'name': 'Lance Bragstad', 'email': 'lbragstad@redhat.com', 'username': 'ldbragst'}, {'_account_id': 6062, 'name': 'jichenjc', 'email': 'jichenjc@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'jichenjc'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 8175, 'name': 'Rafael Folco', 'email': 'rfolco@redhat.com', 'username': 'rfolco'}, {'_account_id': 8367, 'name': 'Arx Cruz', 'email': 'arxcruz@redhat.com', 'username': 'arxcruz'}, {'_account_id': 9578, 'name': 'DB Datasets CI', 'email': 'turbo-hipster@lists.rcbops.com', 'username': 'turbo-hipster', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-02-03 18:13:03.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/blockinfo.py', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt_blockinfo.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/utils.py'], 'message': 'Set SCSI as the default cdrom bus for PowerKVM

Set the default cdrom bus to scsi when the guest architecture is
ppc64 and the hypervisor is kvm|qemu. Checks the arch from
image_meta. Fallback to host arch if arch is not present in the
metadata associated with the image.

KVM unit tests without image_meta unified in a loop.

Change-Id: I62d1490ee8c9ba45a087f934342f14386ddb7cb2
'}]
commit_message:
Set SCSI as the default cdrom bus for PowerKVM

Set the default cdrom bus to scsi when the guest architecture is
ppc64 and the hypervisor is kvm|qemu. Checks the arch from
image_meta. Fallback to host arch if arch is not present in the
metadata associated with the image.

KVM unit tests without image_meta unified in a loop.

Change-Id: I62d1490ee8c9ba45a087f934342f14386ddb7cb2

commit_message:
Adding support for incremental backups

* Adds a parent argument to backup-create.
* Adds parent_id to the backup create body if present.

Implements: blueprint incremental-backups

commit_message:
Solum M1 argparse-based Python CLI

* Implements text parsing only, no REST communications
* Implements Application create, delete and list
* Implements Assembly create, delete and list
* Includes some very basic unit tests (expand when REST is added)

Partially implements: blueprint solum-minimal-cli

Change-Id: I0b1431ffb84b0c6ee71640483669bf55401dc81b

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-02-04 07:09:47.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/baremetal/pxe.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/tilera.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_utils.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_tilera.py', 'nova/tests/virt/baremetal/test_pxe.py', 'nova/virt/baremetal/utils.py'], 'message': "Use new images when spawning BM instances.

With nova-BM the TFTP files (kernel and ramdisk) are cached between
instances but disks never are (today). We were treating the disk image
the same way but this is incorrect because its filename is 'disk'
rather than '$uuid' and as such it has to be cleaned out whenever a
deploy request is being processed.

Change-Id: I15c8fc25a4c064341b9f1ed51e6df8d1494fbdff
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Use new images when spawning BM instances.

With nova-BM the TFTP files (kernel and ramdisk) are cached between
instances but disks never are (today). We were treating the disk image
the same way but this is incorrect because its filename is 'disk'
rather than '$uuid' and as such it has to be cleaned out whenever a
deploy request is being processed.

Change-Id: I15c8fc25a4c064341b9f1ed51e6df8d1494fbdff
Co-Authored-By: Robert Collins <rbtcollins@hp.com>

subject: Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 4190, 'name': 'lifeless', 'email': 'robertc@robertcollins.net', 'username': 'lifeless'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 6172, 'name': 'Boris Pavlovic', 'email': 'boris@pavlovic.me', 'username': 'boris-42'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-04 19:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'message': "Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid deadlock when stringifying NetworkInfo model

In the libvirt driver, we log information about the instance we're
about to generate XML for, which includes a NetworkInfo model. In
reality, this is a NetworkInfoAsyncWrapper which acquires a lock
on the model. Since we're in the middle of a log statement, we also
hold the logging lock. This happens right after we've fired off an
async request to update information about the instance, which first
acquired the network model lock and then acquired the logging lock
to make a seemingly innocuous log record.

The resulting deadlock is fixed by this patch by stringifying the
NetworkInfo object before making the log call in the libvirt
driver.

Change-Id: I81f35197ab7c74daa84fb51fbaa2df28c025da13
Closes-bug: 1276268

commit_message:
Update keystone.conf to use new provider config

This change uses the [token] provider configuration rather than
the deprecated [signing] token_format to select between PKI and UUID
tokens.

Closes-Bug: #1273946
Change-Id: Ia03c2375326c14d4783df3c0774599c795b25cf2

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 20:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_doc_tools/doctest.py', 'doc/source/man/openstack-doc-test.rst', 'README.rst'], 'message': 'Handle translations

Add a new option -l LANGUAGE to build and publish localized content
that is in generated/$LANGUAGE and copy content to
publish_docs/$LANGUAGE.

Add new option --only-book to build only specific manual.

Read gerrit-doc.properties if exists to pass values to maven.

Change-Id: I6a07fe02428679d0e5e00a4d67f1b11d9c85b262
'}]
commit_message:
Handle translations

Add a new option -l LANGUAGE to build and publish localized content
that is in generated/$LANGUAGE and copy content to
publish_docs/$LANGUAGE.

Add new option --only-book to build only specific manual.

Read gerrit-doc.properties if exists to pass values to maven.

commit_message:
Make the dispatcher responsible to listen()

The dispatcher is now responsible to configure and to get the listener from
the transport.

The server just ask to the dispatcher to build and return a configured
listener for a provider transport.

Partial implements blueprint notification-subscriber-server

Change-Id: I4a6d9620b8239f6d377bc5788b8a90a860b2f02c

Removed duplicated function to create a swap fs

The mkfs() function in common/utils.py already can be used to create
a swap fs on a device, so there's no need to create another one in the
deploy_utils.py file.

subject: Add optional-requirements.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 09:17:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox-tmpl.ini', 'optional-requirements.txt', 'tox.ini', 'README.md'], 'message': "Add optional-requirements.txt

While 'optional requirements' phrase is somewhat self-contradicting,
that's what we really have: requirements of optional (pluggable) parts
of TaskFlow are optional in the sense that one can use TaskFlow
without them.

This change puts all such requirements into optional-requirements.txt to
have all them documented in one place, uses that file to list deps for
default python 2.7 test environment.

Change-Id: Ibeeb6ac68247697790cbc2a2c24d2e9f59a4479c
"}]
commit_message:
Add optional-requirements.txt

While 'optional requirements' phrase is somewhat self-contradicting,
that's what we really have: requirements of optional (pluggable) parts
of TaskFlow are optional in the sense that one can use TaskFlow
without them.

This change puts all such requirements into optional-requirements.txt to
have all them documented in one place, uses that file to list deps for
default python 2.7 test environment.

Change-Id: Ibeeb6ac68247697790cbc2a2c24d2e9f59a4479c

commit_message:
Change the role order in os-network

The migerate network database in openstack-network::server depends on
the network plugin package should be installed first, so I move the
os-network-server to the end of run list.

Closes-Bug: #1270708

Change-Id: I0ebc0c7d30dc2132e36eda0ae613e4f92f24361b

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2014-02-03 16:06:01.000000000', 'files': ['tests/v2/test_images.py', 'glanceclient/v2/images.py', 'glanceclient/v2/shell.py', 'glanceclient/common/http.py', 'tests/utils.py', 'tests/test_http.py', 'tests/v2/test_shell_v2.py'], 'message': 'Add support for image size in v2 api upload

Some backend stores e.g. RBD, will fail if told to create an
image without a valid size (RBD will fail to write to a zero-size
image). Here we add support to allow the image size to be provided
when doing an upload. The result is that the upload content-length
will be set if available either from checking the supplied file
object or as provided by user.

Closes-Bug: 1220197
Change-Id: Ia1f2ea5680a139750d931591949b3e0058148b4b
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for image size in v2 api upload

Some backend stores e.g. RBD, will fail if told to create an
image without a valid size (RBD will fail to write to a zero-size
image). Here we add support to allow the image size to be provided
when doing an upload. The result is that the upload content-length
will be set if available either from checking the supplied file
object or as provided by user.

Closes-Bug: 1220197
Change-Id: Ia1f2ea5680a139750d931591949b3e0058148b4b

commit_message:
Use Resource() class from common Oslo code

In the process of unification of the clients code we should
reuse common functionality from Oslo. Resource() class from trove
duplicates Oslo funclionality, so we replace it with inheritance

Related to blueprint common-client-library-2

Change-Id: I9809bd3036a5b544b8ff011432f64dc5af793f61

commit_message:
Support Extensions to Trove Client

extensions on the contrib path (i.e. troveclient/v1/contrib/*.py),
extensions on the python path that follow the naming convention of
*_python_troveclient_ext, and entry-points will now be discovered
and loaded.

due to the mismatch of the api version and the troveclient
package name, '1.0' vs. '1', the client has been patched to look
for contrib in troveclient/v1 vs. the standard troveclient/v1_0

Change-Id: I3ea7bb5ba471b0d421581dcfda7216f429cb7b65
Closes-Bug: #1267577

commit_message:
Add ESX quality warning

In line with the other drivers we've been marking as untested,
this patch marks the ESX driver as "not tested" in the logs to
alert admins to the fact. The VCenter driver is being tested
with minesweeper, and thus does not emit a similar message on
startup.

Change-Id: I9217bab01761f68b716cdce3b21c2653abd9afa1

subject: Add rally use command - part 2
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 09:25:37.000000000', 'files': ['rally/cmd/main.py', 'tests/cmd/test_main.py'], 'message': "Add rally use command - part 2

This completes the behaviour of the 'rally use' command.
when the command is called, it creates a file called openrc-{deployid}
in ~/.rally/ which contains instructions to export deployment specific
environment variables

It also creates a symlink ~/.rally/openrc that refers to the latest
deployment called with 'rally use'

It becomes simple to just do 'source ~/.rally/openrc' and then
'nova list'

Implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I51ddfdbf7b8ab41b5b26685dd7b671468d306fe1
"}]
commit_message:
Add rally use command - part 2

This completes the behaviour of the 'rally use' command.
when the command is called, it creates a file called openrc-{deployid}
in ~/.rally/ which contains instructions to export deployment specific
environment variables

It also creates a symlink ~/.rally/openrc that refers to the latest
deployment called with 'rally use'

It becomes simple to just do 'source ~/.rally/openrc' and then
'nova list'

Implements blueprint: rally-use-command

Change-Id: I51ddfdbf7b8ab41b5b26685dd7b671468d306fe1

commit_message:

We will want to call attach in code paths other than booting an instance
(attaching a volume to a running instance for example). This patch
moves the boot specific log message out of the attach method.

subject: Sanify handoff search depth with non-integer replica counts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2013-12-20 03:51:58.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py', 'swift/proxy/server.py'], 'message': "Sanify handoff search depth with non-integer replica counts

On GET, the proxy will go search the primary nodes plus some number of
handoffs for the account/container/object before giving up and
returning a 404. That number is, by default, twice the ring's replica
count. This was fine if your ring had an integral number of replicas,
but could lead to some slightly-odd behavior if you have fractional
replicas.

For example, imagine that you have 3.49 replicas in your object ring;
perhaps you're migrating a cluster from 3 replicas to 4, and you're
being smart and doing it a bit at a time.

On an object GET that all the primary nodes 404ed, the proxy would
then compute 2 * 3.49 = 6.98, round it up to 7, and go look at 7
handoff nodes. This is sort of weird; the intent was to look at 6
handoffs for objects with 3 replicas, and 8 handoffs for objects with
4, but the effect is 7 for everybody.

You also get little latency cliffs as you scale up replica counts. If,
instead of 3.49, you had 3.51 replicas, then the proxy would look at 8
handoff nodes in every case [ceil(2 * 3.51) = 8], so there'd be a
small-but-noticeable jump in the time it takes to produce a 404.

The fix is to compute the number of handoffs based on the number of
primary nodes for the partition, not the ring's replica count. This
gets rid of the little latency cliffs and makes the behavior more like
what you get with integral replica counts.

If your ring has an integral number of replicas, there's no behavior
change here.

Change-Id: I50538941e571135299fd6b86ecd9dc780cf649f5
"}]
commit_message:
Sanify handoff search depth with non-integer replica counts

On GET, the proxy will go search the primary nodes plus some number of
handoffs for the account/container/object before giving up and
returning a 404. That number is, by default, twice the ring's replica
count. This was fine if your ring had an integral number of replicas,
but could lead to some slightly-odd behavior if you have fractional
replicas.

For example, imagine that you have 3.49 replicas in your object ring;
perhaps you're migrating a cluster from 3 replicas to 4, and you're
being smart and doing it a bit at a time.

On an object GET that all the primary nodes 404ed, the proxy would
then compute 2 * 3.49 = 6.98, round it up to 7, and go look at 7
handoff nodes. This is sort of weird; the intent was to look at 6
handoffs for objects with 3 replicas, and 8 handoffs for objects with
4, but the effect is 7 for everybody.

You also get little latency cliffs as you scale up replica counts. If,
instead of 3.49, you had 3.51 replicas, then the proxy would look at 8
handoff nodes in every case [ceil(2 * 3.51) = 8], so there'd be a
small-but-noticeable jump in the time it takes to produce a 404.

The fix is to compute the number of handoffs based on the number of
primary nodes for the partition, not the ring's replica count. This
gets rid of the little latency cliffs and makes the behavior more like
what you get with integral replica counts.

If your ring has an integral number of replicas, there's no behavior
change here.

Change-Id: I50538941e571135299fd6b86ecd9dc780cf649f5

subject: Move scrubber outside the store package
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-04 08:15:23.000000000', 'files': ['glance/store/__init__.py', 'glance/cmd/scrubber.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_scrubber.py', 'glance/scrubber.py'], 'message': "Move scrubber outside the store package

Glance's scrubber was created under the store package because it is
intended to clean up images from stores when `delayed_delete` is
enabled. However, it doesn't really belong there.

Soft delete is a Glance feature that allows images to be deleted
asynchronously as opposed of blocking clients requests during the image
deletion. Therefore, it needs to be store agnostic and live within
Glance's codebase.

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

Change-Id: I25ddbe1f0f1191f33d814dbae5788da7d511773a
"}]
commit_message:
Move scrubber outside the store package

Glance's scrubber was created under the store package because it is
intended to clean up images from stores when `delayed_delete` is
enabled. However, it doesn't really belong there.

Soft delete is a Glance feature that allows images to be deleted
asynchronously as opposed of blocking clients requests during the image
deletion. Therefore, it needs to be store agnostic and live within
Glance's codebase.

Partially-Implements blueprint: create-store-package

Change-Id: I25ddbe1f0f1191f33d814dbae5788da7d511773a

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-03 23:41:08.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/agents.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/agents.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/extended_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/flavor_access.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/flavor_access.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/admin_password.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/extended_volumes.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/schemas/v3/keypairs.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/admin_password.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/keypairs.py'], 'message': 'Rename API schema modules with removing "_schema"

The paths of API schema modules include "/schemas" and they show
API schema clearly. It is not necessary to include "_schema" in
module names. This patch renames the modules with removing "_schema"
from module names.

@validaiton.schema() takes 1 parameter, so calling it by name
is excessive. Then, this patch removes the specified argument.

By applying these changes, we can specify API schema module in one
line with @validation.schema().

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: Ia646e1c2466fa0a1418f757a48d2e6b4f84f7c98
'}]
commit_message:
Rename API schema modules with removing "_schema"

The paths of API schema modules include "/schemas" and they show
API schema clearly. It is not necessary to include "_schema" in
module names. This patch renames the modules with removing "_schema"
from module names.

@validaiton.schema() takes 1 parameter, so calling it by name
is excessive. Then, this patch removes the specified argument.

By applying these changes, we can specify API schema module in one
line with @validation.schema().

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-validation-fw

Change-Id: Ia646e1c2466fa0a1418f757a48d2e6b4f84f7c98

commit_message:
upload_image.sh to support streamOptimized disks

The current version of the script will use "preallocated" as the
disk type of a stream optimized disk. This needs to be fixed by
introspecting the createType of the vmdk file.

Closes-Bug: #1275993

Change-Id: I98594acecf26dd1164870f43890254a19ef23fe9

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2014-01-30 12:59:51.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot.py', 'doc/source/template_guide/hot_spec.rst', 'heat/tests/test_parser.py', 'heat/tests/generic_resource.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'HOT templates get_attr allows extra attributes

The HOT templates now allows the use of extra attributes for the
get_attr function. Wich this change is possible to traverse complex
resource attributes.

For example, getting an IP address for a server on a given network:

when the network name is stable, and always known:
get_attr:
- my_server
- networks
- public
- 0

or if the network name is something other than public:
get_attr:
- my_server
- networks
- get_param: my_network_name
- 0

If one of the extra arguments does not match with a key or a valid
index, an empty string is returned.

As a bonus track the Fn::GetAttr support was removed from the HOT
templates.

Change-Id: Ia7361fbd10611cc796bd90e781f4ae387c970dbd
Implements: blueprint hot-select
'}]
commit_message:
HOT templates get_attr allows extra attributes

The HOT templates now allows the use of extra attributes for the
get_attr function. Wich this change is possible to traverse complex
resource attributes.

For example, getting an IP address for a server on a given network:

when the network name is stable, and always known:
get_attr:
- my_server
- networks
- public
- 0

or if the network name is something other than public:
get_attr:
- my_server
- networks
- get_param: my_network_name
- 0

If one of the extra arguments does not match with a key or a valid
index, an empty string is returned.

As a bonus track the Fn::GetAttr support was removed from the HOT
templates.

Change-Id: Ia7361fbd10611cc796bd90e781f4ae387c970dbd
Implements: blueprint hot-select

commit_message:
Retain the same api for all helpers

Functionality in one helper method seems to not
exist in the other helper methods, even though
they call into the same methods, this seems like
a bad inconsistency to have so we should fix that
and have a consistent api for all of these helper
methods instead.

Change-Id: I72aa66e5920a6093fc9df0c261c950a9cb225b76

commit_message:
Validation of job execution data should raise InvalidDataException

There is a check on job execution data that currently raises
InvalidException, which is the base type for bad object references.
It should raise InvalidDataException instead.

Change-Id: I19f156aff43968e7a5c0a51c0cfa7199d32b70f2

commit_message:
Sync db.sqlalchemy code from Oslo

Patch contains common code from Oslo, we need to sync this modules to fix
a problem with a newer version of sqlite and the db.sqlachemy module that
is causing some of tests to fail if the version of the sqlite is >=3.7.16.

The patch also includes the code needed with the transition from migrate
tool to alembic, these base migration classes depends on the py3kcompat
and test modules which were also added to the project.

Closes-Bug: #1272500
Change-Id: Ifcd1254f16506a4247523056d6ad4ad8d7aefdac

commit_message:
Fix policy tests for parallel testing

After enabling parallel testing for most of oslo-incubator, I
found that a number of the policy tests were failing consistently
due to order-dependent behavior in them.  This change fixes all
of the issues that I saw in local testing.

Change-Id: I670415d616db433d17186f496f43c961aaeb2e9b
Closes-Bug: #1275150
Related-Bug: #1272035

commit_message:
Fix glance-swift user in keystone_data

    When glance-swift was added a strict check was used to
    conditionally add this user.  The script now uses the function
    "is_service_enabled" to make it more resilient to further
    changes.

Closes-Bug: #1276029
Change-Id: I6e85ca45c4d2561172f768afef9f0d67a7092fac

Also, the content field (the ip address) is now passed to the driver

commit_message:
Changing DNS to pass string to driver

This commit also moves the "get_ip_address" functions out of
instance.views and into the models code under the SimpleInstance class,
where it's renamed get_visible_ip_addresses().
Also, the content field (the ip address) is now passed to the driver
instead of set on the Entry object by the manager, which allows more
flexibility for dealing with various drivers and will hopefully prevent
issues in the future.
Finally, integration tests were added to keep this from breaking
in the future.

Closes-Bug: 1273446

Change-Id: I70bf37838cc5cecfe579fe6001df79d7f6f5d53e

subject: heat_keystoneclient: abstract admin_client to a property
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-31 12:05:16.000000000', 'files': ['heat/common/heat_keystoneclient.py', 'heat/tests/test_heatclient.py'], 'message': 'heat_keystoneclient: abstract admin_client to a property

To make the connection to keystone with admin credentials reusable
store the admin client object at the class level rather than local
to create_trust_context.  This will avoid the overhead of
getting two authenticated clients when other admin operations are
necessary.

Change-Id: Iaa043b829778f71d03e64a78ccb3f51eadfb3fba
blueprint: instance-users
'}]
commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient: abstract admin_client to a property

To make the connection to keystone with admin credentials reusable
store the admin client object at the class level rather than local
to create_trust_context.  This will avoid the overhead of
getting two authenticated clients when other admin operations are
necessary.

Change-Id: Iaa043b829778f71d03e64a78ccb3f51eadfb3fba
blueprint: instance-users

commit_message:
Upgrade rubocop

Rubocop 0.18.1 has been released, which includes the reported
inconsistent class documentation cop triggering fix. This release also
contains some new cops and fixes others, triggering new violations on
existing rubocopped code.

- Upgrade rubocop to 0.18.1
- Fix new/corrected violations

Change-Id: Ia66ce8521c06a94bc28928784161d657da50f215
Addresses: blueprint rubocop-for-object-storage

commit_message:
Copy all generated books to common path

Copy all generated books to directory publish-docs in the git top-level
so that Jenkins can publish them on docs-draft.

Also copies www directory over if files in it where changed.

The tool now uses a config-file "doc-test-conf" which is expected in the
top-level of the repository.

blueprint draft-docs-on-docs-draft

Change-Id: Iea67050d827407f2f71585372c673f7f1dbccc46

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-01-30 19:53:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/vif.py', 'etc/nova/nova.conf.sample', 'nova/tests/virt/libvirt/fakelibvirt.py'], 'message': "Add support for hypervisor type autodetection

Adds support for detecting the type of the hypervisor automatically
(as opposed to manually setting the config option) by setting
'libvirt.virt_type' to 'auto'. Then, None will be passed as the
libvirt connection URI (unless a URI is explicitly set), and the
'hypervisor_type' property in driver.py will query libvirt for
the current hypervisor type, and cache that value for future use.
If 'libvirt.virt_type' is not 'auto', 'hypervisor_type' will just
use 'CONF.libvirt_type'.  Similar code was also added to the VIF driver.

Similiar code was added for 'hypervisor_uri' in driver.py

Fixes: bug #1100366
Change-Id: I20e2c50f28a92d66e243559b330e2456d84214c0
"}]
commit_message:
Add support for hypervisor type autodetection

Adds support for detecting the type of the hypervisor automatically
(as opposed to manually setting the config option) by setting
'libvirt.virt_type' to 'auto'. Then, None will be passed as the
libvirt connection URI (unless a URI is explicitly set), and the
'hypervisor_type' property in driver.py will query libvirt for
the current hypervisor type, and cache that value for future use.
If 'libvirt.virt_type' is not 'auto', 'hypervisor_type' will just
use 'CONF.libvirt_type'.  Similar code was also added to the VIF driver.

Similiar code was added for 'hypervisor_uri' in driver.py

Fixes: bug #1100366
Change-Id: I20e2c50f28a92d66e243559b330e2456d84214c0

subject: Map neutron_management_network to net_id in CLI
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6786, 'name': 'Sergey Lukjanov', 'email': 'me@slukjanov.name', 'username': 'slukjanov'}, {'_account_id': 7125, 'name': 'Alexander Ignatov', 'email': 'aignatov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aignatov'}, {'_account_id': 7555, 'name': 'Matthew Farrellee', 'email': 'matt@redhat.com', 'username': 'farrellee'}, {'_account_id': 8090, 'name': 'Chad Roberts', 'email': 'croberts@redhat.com', 'username': 'croberts'}, {'_account_id': 8091, 'name': 'Trevor McKay', 'email': 'tmckay@redhat.com', 'username': 'tmckay'}, {'_account_id': 8411, 'name': 'Andrew Lazarev', 'email': 'alazarev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'alazarev'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-02 14:08:26.000000000', 'files': ['savannaclient/api/shell.py'], 'message': 'Map neutron_management_network to net_id in CLI

The JSON representation of a cluster uses neutron_management_network
as a property name. The CLI allows for JSON injest, which is then
translated into a ClusterManager.create call. The injest maps property
names to parameter names to ClusterManager.create. This works in all
cases except neutron_management_network, which is the net_id parameter
to create.

To address this, the CLI accepts neutron_management_network and maps
it to the net_id parameter.

Change-Id: I69799d0108740f0e79c82e45714fd946e9a2a4b0
Closes-bug: #1273500
'}]
commit_message:
Map neutron_management_network to net_id in CLI

The JSON representation of a cluster uses neutron_management_network
as a property name. The CLI allows for JSON injest, which is then
translated into a ClusterManager.create call. The injest maps property
names to parameter names to ClusterManager.create. This works in all
cases except neutron_management_network, which is the net_id parameter
to create.

To address this, the CLI accepts neutron_management_network and maps
it to the net_id parameter.

Change-Id: I69799d0108740f0e79c82e45714fd946e9a2a4b0
Closes-bug: #1273500

commit_message:
Replace virt_type CONF option with property

This commit replaces all uses of the `CONF.libvirt.virt_type`
configuration option with an autodetection-friendly property
in prepararation for introducing support for hypervisor type
autodetection.

Change-Id: I9c3d08c5a2d4b8b9be8d3e76be00ed20ca91ffdb
Fixes: bug #1100366

commit_message:
Move the released file lock to the successful path

Instead of logging that the lock was released even
if there was an error that caused it not to be
unreleased we should only log that it was released
after it really was.

Change-Id: Id3f37b801a1d5efd2dcb4a9803989df50a36e7de

subject: Revert "service: replace eventlet event by threading"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-31 13:15:22.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': 'Revert "service: replace eventlet event by threading"

This reverts commit f08f6ba7e80729fb6028b24568da0f651a75fcd6.

This was a terrible idea: as soon as you don't monkey patch threading,
this does not work as expected in the end.

So it's better to say that it's explicitly eventlet mechanisms that are
required, at least for now.

Conflicts:
	tests/unit/test_service.py

Partial-Bug: #1274044

Change-Id: I4d4f112d4550d912c4f81e62bc9a4714cf117384
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "service: replace eventlet event by threading"

This reverts commit f08f6ba7e80729fb6028b24568da0f651a75fcd6.

This was a terrible idea: as soon as you don't monkey patch threading,
this does not work as expected in the end.

So it's better to say that it's explicitly eventlet mechanisms that are
required, at least for now.

Conflicts:
	tests/unit/test_service.py

Partial-Bug: #1274044

Change-Id: I4d4f112d4550d912c4f81e62bc9a4714cf117384

commit_message:
Update python-troveclient version

Reasons:
 - openstack pypi contains new version - 1.0.3;
 - current version in requirements 1.0.0.

 - updating python-troveclient version from 1.0.0 to 1.0.3

commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient ensure admin client respects SSL options

The SSL related fixes merged under blueprint clients-ssl-options
and bug #1213122 missed the transient client created by
create_trust_context, so add the required options to
service_admin_creds, such that any client created using the
service admin credentials will use SSL if configured to do so.

Change-Id: Iab25c5ee6ec5cba9aaaccb93ce4e680e2f9cd9ac
Related-Bug: #1213122

pass WSGI requests directly to the app for now, at look into adding a

commit_message:
test(functional): Use direct WSGI requests in lieu of a wsgiref server

The wsgiref server is very flaky when running in the gate, so let's just
pass WSGI requests directly to the app for now, at look into adding a
devstack job to the gate that will use a standalone server.

Change-Id: Ifb6cd0c9080ded7ab93cced6e0d40a776eb2cd50

commit_message:
Added section for Compute node firewall config

Added a new section to the Config Reference on what ports to open on
each compute node (and how). Upon consultation, it seems that adding
a port config section in each component chapter is a better way to
address bug#1261617.

I'll submit follow-up patches adding a firewall configuration section
to each Config Ref Guide chapter/component if this patch gets merged.

Change-Id: Ie53e73b7cd2ec7af81f264338a4676952dd168e1
Partial-Bug: #1261617

commit_message:
Negative test autogeneration framework

Generates and executes negative tests based on a json schema for the API.
It's using testscenarios lib to generate a test case for each variation.
It contains resource handling and result proofing of invalid requests.

Not covered in this patch (will be done later):
- Documentation
- Unit tests
- Actual json schemas for all APIs

Partially-implements: bp negative-tests
Co-author: David Kranz <dkranz@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I828f9b74c31f2e25c91e8149ecd7cd0b189ce99a

subject: Return HTTP 404 Not found for DLO without segments
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-10 09:22:56.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/proxy/test_server.py', 'swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'Return HTTP 404 Not found for DLO without segments

Requesting a DLO manifest returns a 200 even if there no segment at
all. This might be misleading since it is not clear if the segment
objects are missing or if these are just empty.

This patch returns a 404 for DLO requests without any segments and
updates the test to verify this behavior.

Change-Id: I9f8856360a43cae06d03b91c1a8d1ea5041a878b
Closes-Bug: 1267726
'}]
commit_message:
Return HTTP 404 Not found for DLO without segments

Requesting a DLO manifest returns a 200 even if there no segment at
all. This might be misleading since it is not clear if the segment
objects are missing or if these are just empty.

This patch returns a 404 for DLO requests without any segments and
updates the test to verify this behavior.

Change-Id: I9f8856360a43cae06d03b91c1a8d1ea5041a878b
Closes-Bug: 1267726

subject: Remove suffix "JSON" from Nova v3 API last test class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-03 05:09:11.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/compute/v3/servers/test_server_metadata_negative.py'], 'message': 'Remove suffix "JSON" from Nova v3 API last test class

We have decided that XML support is removed from Nova v3 API and
the tests also has been removed from Tempest already.
Then the suffix "JSON" of Nova v3 API test classes does not have
any meanings.

This patch removes them for cleanup. This is made because of a
comment of Ie3c595fb77143e58e30404c42f358d6443a52c0b .

NOTE: Most of the test classes already don't have the suffix
"JSON" with this: Ic7372817777256ce723843ffd3e0bc670261aa78 .
This is the last one of having the suffix "JSON" of Nova v3 API
test class.

Part of bp:remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: I6ce769eaed89ef46f0c488ab99b5ed674f2f53a2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove suffix "JSON" from Nova v3 API last test class

We have decided that XML support is removed from Nova v3 API and
the tests also has been removed from Tempest already.
Then the suffix "JSON" of Nova v3 API test classes does not have
any meanings.

This patch removes them for cleanup. This is made because of a
comment of Ie3c595fb77143e58e30404c42f358d6443a52c0b .

NOTE: Most of the test classes already don't have the suffix
"JSON" with this: Ic7372817777256ce723843ffd3e0bc670261aa78 .
This is the last one of having the suffix "JSON" of Nova v3 API
test class.

Part of bp:remove-v3-xml-api

Change-Id: I6ce769eaed89ef46f0c488ab99b5ed674f2f53a2

commit_message:
Checks min requirements before trying to launch an instance

  Server side version.

An image can have properties min_ram/min_disk that prevents
to launch instance with a flavor doesn't have enough resources.

Notes:
  Adds in create_instance.py a solution to check requirements
  Adds in glance_data.py ram/disk properties for and image (default:0)
  Fix in tests.py, some ut needed to be updated
  Adds in tests.py two new tests to check min_disk and min_ram

Change-Id: Ia4a9e4ed729321f70de93296e3257898a52c8e32
Implements: blueprint image-flavor-minimun-requirements

subject: Only enable MySQL TRADITIONAL mode if we're running against MySQL
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-01-29 16:29:13.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py'], 'message': "Only enable MySQL TRADITIONAL mode if we're running against MySQL

Change I2960435c81d21f5a65ea7fa4dc5c100880cf6aef, which enabled
MySQL TRADITIONAL mode, erroneously would attempt to enable that
MySQL-specific mode on both MySQL and DB2 connections. Only enable
TRADITIONAL mode when actually running against MySQL.

Change-Id: I28c40c47e2515112555f2abdd2ecc4dc5c3399f6
"}]
commit_message:
Only enable MySQL TRADITIONAL mode if we're running against MySQL

Change I2960435c81d21f5a65ea7fa4dc5c100880cf6aef, which enabled
MySQL TRADITIONAL mode, erroneously would attempt to enable that
MySQL-specific mode on both MySQL and DB2 connections. Only enable
TRADITIONAL mode when actually running against MySQL.

Change-Id: I28c40c47e2515112555f2abdd2ecc4dc5c3399f6

subject: Move kazoo to testenv requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-04 09:17:00.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'tox-tmpl.ini', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Move kazoo to testenv requirements

Kazoo is an optional dependency of taskflow: it is required when
zookeeper persistence layer or if kazoo_utils are used. So we should
move it to where these type of optional requirements are currently
placed.

Change-Id: I9d1605af266f4a79fd6ebfee2d68a4f4f7413022
'}]
commit_message:
Move kazoo to testenv requirements

Kazoo is an optional dependency of taskflow: it is required when
zookeeper persistence layer or if kazoo_utils are used. So we should
move it to where these type of optional requirements are currently
placed.

Change-Id: I9d1605af266f4a79fd6ebfee2d68a4f4f7413022

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-17 14:18:08.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/test/tests/base.py', 'horizon/test/tests/tabs.py'], 'message': 'Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I5e7afcdc7be36e64168ef850749dfcb5a19e784a
Closes-Bug: #1268480
'}]
commit_message:
Change assertTrue(isinstance()) by optimal assert

Some of tests use different method of assertTrue(isinstance(A, B)) or
assertEqual(type(A), B). The correct way is to use assertIsInstance(A,
B) provided by testtools.

Change-Id: I5e7afcdc7be36e64168ef850749dfcb5a19e784a
Closes-Bug: #1268480

Modified keystone endpoint-create default region

The default region is changed from regionOne to RegionOne for other service use RegionOne as default, and we should standardize on a specific default value.

Closes-Bug: #1252299

commit_message:
Make devtest use COMPUTESCALE for overcloud

The COMPUTESCALE variable allows a variable number of compute nodes to
be created. Devtest needs to be aware of this and provision the correct
resources.

Change-Id: Icd5a5ec94dcac7e8fd376da496e4584b436cdd09

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-01-20 10:53:14.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/services/object_storage/account_client.py', 'tempest/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest/api/object_storage/test_account_bulk.py', 'tempest/common/custom_matchers.py'], 'message': 'Add tests for testing swift bulk middleware

Add tests for two functions of Swift bulk operations.
- PUT operation to extract containers and objects on Swift cluster from
  uploaded archived file
- DELETE operation to delete multiple containers and objects listed in
  the request body

To implement these tests, I modify delete operation in rest_client.py
to include request body in HTTP DELETE request and fix minor bugs.

Change-Id: I263d903f14fe777153a543640a54464f93d6c008
Implements: blueprint test-swift-bulk-middleware
Related-Bug: #1240856
'}]
commit_message:
Add tests for testing swift bulk middleware

Add tests for two functions of Swift bulk operations.
- PUT operation to extract containers and objects on Swift cluster from
  uploaded archived file
- DELETE operation to delete multiple containers and objects listed in
  the request body

To implement these tests, I modify delete operation in rest_client.py
to include request body in HTTP DELETE request and fix minor bugs.

Change-Id: I263d903f14fe777153a543640a54464f93d6c008
Implements: blueprint test-swift-bulk-middleware
Related-Bug: #1240856

commit_message:
glance requires pyOpenSSL>=0.11

glance uses  OpenSSL.crypto.sign() and OpenSSL.crypto.verify(), which
are new in pyOpenSSL 0.11. Global requirements already fixed, do the
same change in glance

Partial-Bug: #1268966

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2014-01-31 11:35:40.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/utils.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/migration_cli/ext_migrate.py', 'openstack/common/db/sqlalchemy/test_migrations.py'], 'message': "Drop dependency on log from oslo db code

Openstack common log module registers a few oslo.config options,
which can possibly lead to unpleasant issues (DuplicateOptError)
when we split oslo.db from oslo-incubator into a separate library
and reuse both log and oslo.db in target projects.

We don't use for example, any of the special formatting supported by
ContextAdaptor so we can use logging module from python standart library
instead of common log module.

Related to blueprint oslo-db-lib

Change-Id: I6ec426274eb3b603dbbc894762edb97515a618b2
"}]
commit_message:
Drop dependency on log from oslo db code

Openstack common log module registers a few oslo.config options,
which can possibly lead to unpleasant issues (DuplicateOptError)
when we split oslo.db from oslo-incubator into a separate library
and reuse both log and oslo.db in target projects.

We don't use for example, any of the special formatting supported by
ContextAdaptor so we can use logging module from python standart library
instead of common log module.

Related to blueprint oslo-db-lib

Change-Id: I6ec426274eb3b603dbbc894762edb97515a618b2

commit_message:
Add some tests for bin/swift-recon

Fix also minor bug in zone filtering when zone set to 0.

Moved bin/swift-recon to swift/cli/recon.py, which makes
it possible to import it without using some scary hacks.
bin/swift-recon is now created by setup.py install.

Closes-Bug: #1261692
Change-Id: Id0729991c8ece73604467480dbf93fec7d8eb196

subject: Bump python-keystoneclient to version 0.5.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 08:26:22.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Bump python-keystoneclient to version 0.5.0

A new version of keystoneclient has been released, containing features
we want to make use of, in particular the extensible-crud-manager-operations
BP which will allow us to clean up some of the filtering workarounds in
heat_keystoneclient.py

We need the global requirements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70929/
update before this can merge.

Change-Id: I4e0c9475a3e460fabc8b18976130e8ad9ec2e0f3
'}]
commit_message:
Bump python-keystoneclient to version 0.5.0

A new version of keystoneclient has been released, containing features
we want to make use of, in particular the extensible-crud-manager-operations
BP which will allow us to clean up some of the filtering workarounds in
heat_keystoneclient.py

We need the global requirements https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70929/
update before this can merge.

Change-Id: I4e0c9475a3e460fabc8b18976130e8ad9ec2e0f3

commit_message:
Enforce FlavorExtraSpecs Key format.

When creating a key name with characters like '/' that are not
being encoded or cannot be handled as expected by routes when
matching the url, then it's not possible to remove them anymore.
The new format apply the restriction: "[\w\.\- :]+$"

This change will fix the bug without API change.

Change-Id: I64bc098c4bde33c40fa149191a751ea3eb19f932
Closes-Bug: #1256119

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-01-30 08:41:11.000000000', 'files': ['glance/api/v2/image_data.py', 'glance/domain/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_image_data_resource.py'], 'message': "Restore image status to 'queued' if upload failed

In v2, we're removing 'killed' status so as to let user
can retry upload if there is a failure. But based on

status when upload failed. This fix will restore the

commit_message:
Restore image status to 'queued' if upload failed

In v2, we're removing 'killed' status so as to let user
can retry upload if there is a failure. But based on
current implement, the image will be stuck in 'saving'
status when upload failed. This fix will restore the
image status to 'queued' to avoid the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1273087

Change-Id: Icd318e3e8d90b6837c84666c47f720b93febe228

commit_message:
Add Requirement for Storage Policy Names

With recent patches we've added exposure of policy names to clients
so to avoid confusion we have decided to require nameing them in
swift.conf (before you could get away without a name).

Change-Id: I576f7e9e03be97addaae479f1865fd7791581cc6
Implements: blueprint storage-policies

commit_message:
Removed -cciss-* tail from /dev/disk/by-path links

It is to address the issue which appears when centos
udev names smart array devices like this
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:06:00.0-cciss-disk0
and debian-installer udev names them like this
/dev/disk/by-path/pci-0000:06:00.0 and can not
find device.

Change-Id: I052ae1839b49f4abbd12f44582d53923e0836411

subject: Import test from tests.py in tests/ directory
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-27 01:30:02.000000000', 'files': ['tests/deploy/engines/test_devstack.py', 'tests/serverprovider/providers/test_lxc.py', 'tests/serverprovider/providers/test_virsh.py', 'tests/cmd/test_main.py', 'tests/cmd/test_envutils.py'], 'message': 'Import test from tests.py in tests/ directory

In some test files in tests/ directory, test modules are imported
from rally.openstack.common which contains BaseTestCase. However,
most of test modules are imported from tests (i.e. tests.py) and
test cases are inherited from TestCase which is inherited from
BaseTestCase.

To make them consistent, make them be imported from tests.

Change-Id: Ic158f32d81df47b90564e26f70cc341ab7403095
'}]
commit_message:
Import test from tests.py in tests/ directory

In some test files in tests/ directory, test modules are imported
from rally.openstack.common which contains BaseTestCase. However,
most of test modules are imported from tests (i.e. tests.py) and
test cases are inherited from TestCase which is inherited from
BaseTestCase.

To make them consistent, make them be imported from tests.

Change-Id: Ic158f32d81df47b90564e26f70cc341ab7403095
